Detailed Description

Class that models a html area object from the chisimba core modules.

It basically an interface class between the hosportal module and the chisimba core modules. This creates less dependancy on chisimba and increases flexibility and maintainability. This html area object produces a small simple word proccessor type object that lets type in text and select numerous options that are inate to most other word proccesors.

Author:
Salman Noor
MIU Intern
School of Electrical Engineering, WITS Unversity
Version:
0.68
Date:
May 3, 2010

Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this class

Member Function Documentation

createNewObjectFromModule ( $  name_of_class = 'htmlarea',
$  name_of_module = 'htmlelements' 
)

Creates an object from the chisimba core modules.

Parameters:
name_of_class A string with default value set to no other than the html area class.
name_of_module A string with default value set to the module in which the confirm class is stored ie html elements.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
A new html area object to be used.

Return an new empty confirm action object.

If you called this method without any arguments (parameters), don't sweat it, the default arguments will take care of everything.

EditModule (  ) 

In the future if required, this html area module can be modified or augmented using this member function.

Nothing is implemented currently.

Reimplemented from chisimba_modules_handler.

setHTMLAreaName ( $  name_of_HTML_area  ) 

Member function to set the name of the object the text will be eqauted to. Once this is set, then it can be used as a parameter anywhere else.

Parameters:
name_of_HTML_area A string. The name of the variable will become a parameter.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
Text that is inputted will be stored in this parameter.

Returns a member function from the confirm class of the chisimba core modules.

If you call this method without any arguments, you would not be setting anything.

Definition at line 75 of file htmlarea_module_class_inc.php.

setInputVariableForHTMLArea ( $  name_of_input_variable  ) 

Member function to set the name of the variable the text will be eqauted to. Once this is set, then it can be used as a parameter anywhere else.

Parameters:
name_of_input_variable A string. The name of the variable will become a parameter.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
Text that is inputted will be stored in this parameter.

Returns a member function from the confirm class of the chisimba core modules.

If you call this method without any arguments, you would not be setting anything.

Definition at line 62 of file htmlarea_module_class_inc.php.

setToolBarType (  ) 

Member function to set the tool bar type. The default tool bar that has the most options is selected. If you want to change this toolbar then choose another member function from the html area class in the html elements module.

Returns:
A toolbar that will be displayed on top of the text area.

Returns a member function from the confirm class of the chisimba core modules.

Definition at line 88 of file htmlarea_module_class_inc.php.

showHTMLArea (  ) 

Method to display the html area object.

Returns:
A member function from the html area class of the chisimba core modules.

Once the html area object has been completely modelled, then called this method.

Definition at line 97 of file htmlarea_module_class_inc.php.

Field Documentation

$HTMLArea [private]

Private data member of class htmlarea_module that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the html area class in the html elements core module of chisimba. This object models one html area object.
